meanings.sent1: The group of putterers gathered in the garden to tinker with their tools.
meanings.sent2: The retiree enjoyed being a putterer, spending his days fixing small gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The putterers at the workshop joked about who was the best at fixing things.
meanings.sent4: She was the queen of putterers, always finding a way to make broken items work again.
meanings.sent5: The neighborhood was known for its community of putterers who loved to repair old bicycles.

meanings.definition: To busy oneself in a leisurely or aimless manner.
meanings.sent1: On lazy afternoons, they would putter around the house, rearranging furniture.
meanings.sent2: She liked to putter in the garden, planting flowers without any rush.
meanings.sent3: The children puttered around the playground, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the old man would putter in his shed, lost in thought.
meanings.sent5: The cat would putter around the room, chasing imaginary mice with playful swats.

meanings.definition: To move or act slowly or lazily.
meanings.sent1: The turtle putterers along the path, taking its time to reach the pond.
meanings.sent2: The old dog likes to putter around the yard, sniffing at every bush.
meanings.sent3: The sloth putterers through the trees, its movements almost imperceptible.
meanings.sent4: The river putterers through the valley, meandering lazily under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The clouds putterers across the sky, casting shadows over the fields below.
